original_text: In these frameworks, however, the physical spacetime dimension is an input rather than a prediction of the theory. In fact, in standard theories whose gravitational sector is described by the Einstein–Hilbert action, there is no obstruction to perform dimensional reductions to spacetimes of dimensions d≠4. Then the question arises, since eleven-dimensional Minkowski space is a maximally (super)symmetric state, and the theory is well-behaved around it, why the theory does not select this configuration as the vacuum, but instead, it chooses a particular compactified space with less symmetry. An ideal situation, instead, would be that the eleven-dimensional theory dynamically predicted a low energy regime which could only be a four-dimensional effective theory. In such a scenario, a background solution with an effective spacetime dimension d>4 should be expected to be a false vacuum where the propagators for the dynamical fields are ill-defined, lest a low energy effective theory could exist in dimensions higher than four.
original_translation: En estos marcos, sin embargo, la dimensión del espacio-tiempo físico es un dato de entrada en lugar de una predicción de la teoría. De hecho, en las teorías estándar cuyo sector gravitacional está descrito por la acción de Einstein-Hilbert, no hay ninguna obstrucción para realizar reducciones dimensionales a espacios-tiempo de dimensiones d≠4. Entonces surge la pregunta, dado que el espacio de Minkowski de once dimensiones es un estado máximamente (super)simétrico, y la teoría se comporta de manera adecuada alrededor de él, ¿por qué la teoría no selecciona esta configuración como el vacío, sino que en cambio elige un espacio compactificado particular con menos simetría? Una situación ideal, en cambio, sería que la teoría de once dimensiones predijera dinámicamente un régimen de baja energía que solo pudiera ser una teoría efectiva de cuatro dimensiones. En un escenario así, se debería esperar una solución de fondo con una dimensión efectiva del espacio tiempo d>4 que sea un falso vacío donde los propagadores de los campos dinámicos estén mal definidos, a menos que pueda existir una teoría efectiva de baja energía en dimensiones superiores a cuatro.
original_sentences: In these frameworks, however, the physical spacetime dimension is an input rather than a prediction of the theory.
In fact, in standard theories whose gravitational sector is described by the Einstein–Hilbert action, there is no obstruction to perform dimensional reductions to spacetimes of dimensions d≠4.

Then the question arises, since eleven-dimensional Minkowski space is a maximally (super)symmetric state, and the theory is well-behaved around it, why the theory does not select this configuration as the vacuum, but instead, it chooses a particular compactified space with less symmetry.
An ideal situation, instead, would be that the eleven-dimensional theory dynamically predicted a low energy regime which could only be a four-dimensional effective theory.

In such a scenario, a background solution with an effective spacetime dimension d>4 should be expected to be a false vacuum where the propagators for the dynamical fields are ill-defined, lest a low energy effective theory could exist in dimensions higher than four.

en dimensiones superiores a cuatro.

original_annotated_sentences: In these frameworks, however, the physical spacetime dimension is an input rather than a prediction of the theory.
In fact, in standard theories whose gravitational sector is described by the Einstein–Hilbert action, there is no obstruction to perform dimensional reductions to spacetimes of dimensions d≠4.

Then the question arises, since eleven-dimensional Minkowski space is a maximally (super)symmetric state, and the theory is well-behaved around it, why the theory does not select this configuration as the vacuum, but instead, it chooses a particular compactified space with less symmetry.

An ideal situation, instead, would be that the eleven-dimensional theory dynamically predicted a
low energy regime
which could only be a four-dimensional effective theory.

In such a scenario, a background solution with an effective spacetime dimension d>4 should be expected to be a false vacuum where the propagators for the dynamical fields are ill-defined, lest a low energy effective theory could exist in dimensions higher than four.

An ideal situation, instead, would be that the eleven-dimensional theory dynamically predicted a
low energy regime
which could only be a four-dimensional effective theory.
translated_annotated_samples:
Output: Una situación ideal, en cambio, sería que la teoría de once dimensiones predijera dinámicamente un
regimen de baja energía
que solo podría ser una teoría efectiva de cuatro dimensiones.
